messages.message:
@Xindi Xu i just added a new member to an org on aihub-sandbox, and i got a blank screen with this error message (https://react.dev/errors/152?invariant=152&args%5B%5D=cell) *`Nothing was returned from render. This usually means a return statement is missing. Or, to render nothing, return null.`*

should we have an ErrorBoundary around this page/component?
@Jessica since you've been working on this recently. Yea, i think adding error boundary makes sense
I have on my backlog to add error boundaries to this - will also look into the actual error asap once my crafting sandbox is back
Hmm I can't reproduce this, either on this sandbox or on crafting. Have you been able to reproduce again Serena? I wonder if it happens when there's an error or something...

hmm iâ€™m not able to reproduce as well :sob:

maybe it was a transient thing?
Oh I just got this error without even doing anything on sandbox!! I just went back to the page and it was there
I can reproduce on sandbox now - open organization settings, navigate to workspace settings, then back to org settings. There must be a member with something odd going on.

One thing I realized as I was investigating this is that if you have groups enabled, if there's a member of a group who's not a member of the org you're currently in, it will break. This won't be a problem once we switch to the v2 group endpoints

Okay I believe I've found the issue - there are some profiles coming back from the endpoint that are just this object: `{found: false}`. I'm not sure if they were recently deleted or if my migration to TableGrid made this break. I'm going to put in a change to filter those out.
The table breaks when you scroll down to about the "e"s, and eric han is the first person where this is an issue haha
ohh, nice find! Yea, if the current user can't access the user profile or if the user is deactivated, it will return `{found: false}`
